Action Cable Status Reporter

This app tracks the status of vehicles on a car lot. It pushes updates to users' browsers via Action Cable when the status_id field of a car changes. It works both for browser-initiated updates as well as console-initiated updates (as a stand-in for ETL db updates). When a browser user updates a car's status, they get the normal Rails notice and all other users get an Action Cable alert. If an update happens via the console, all users get an Action Cable alert.

Check out the repo README for code snippets
and screenshots of the most interesting parts.

Tech Used: Rails 5.0.1, Action Cable, Redis, Ruby 2.5.0, PostgreSQL, Coffee Script, jQuery

My Role: solo project, full stack
